items: Adjust the seat and backrest to a comfortable position.
Place your feet on the footplate shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the handles on either side of the seat for stability.
Slowly lower the weight by bending your knees until they are at a 90-degree angle.
Push the weight back up using your legs until your legs are straight but not locked.
Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
When finished, release the handles and carefully step off the machine.
Strengthens leg muscles, including quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes
Improves overall lower body strength and power
Can help improve athletic performance in sports such as running, jumping, and cycling
May help improve bone density and reduce risk of osteoporosis
Can be a low-impact exercise option for those with joint pain or injuries
